intro: Tragia muelleriana var. cordata, commonly known as the cordate tragia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the warmer months. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. The species is noted for its adaptability to harsh conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
